attributes.action: Stop planning permission for a flamingo park on Scotlands beloved loch lomond
attributes.additional_details: It would seem that local objection isn't enough to stop this development. It has been rejected more than once yet keeps returning to the table . The would be developer is persistent in his ambition, this development application having being in play since 2018 in some form or another. Its obscene to consider decorating Loch lomond with such a tacky Blackpool-ish 'attraction'. Lomond is part of the trossachs national park yet has been subjected to over commercialisation. We need to protect it!
attributes.background: Prevent the going ahead of the crass development of a flamingo park on the shores of Loch lomond. It has been resoundedly rejected on a number of occasions but from media reports now seems to be getting pushed through anyway. It will be an unwanted eyesore. At the very least ask scotgov to justify.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. 
 
Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament. 
 
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
